text:
Hi guys. I am Laura Vitale. On this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen I am going to show

you how to make butter cookies with a super
simple and delicious chocolate glaze. They

are so addictive and so easy. The ingredients
are probably in your pantry and refrigerator

right now, which are some all purpose plain
flour, a pinch of salt, some plain old sugar,

an egg, some unsalted butter at room temperature
and some vanilla extract. These are the ingredients

to make the actual cookies and in a little
bit I will show you the ingredients to make

the little glaze. So so good. So the first
thing you want to do is get your oven preheated

to 375F. The second thing you want to do is
take a couple of baking sheets and line them

with some parchment paper. So, I am going
to make this in my standing mixer to make

life a little easier. Now you will want to
start by creaming together the butter and

sugar. It is pretty standard steps. Butter
and sugar first. Cream it together then add

in the eggs and vanilla. Now I am just going
to mix that in until it is nice and combined.

I am actually going to speed it up a little
bit. Scrape the sides, especially since this

is such a big mixer with a big bowl, and the
batter is not huge, or not a lot of it I should

say. So, as that mixes up I am just going
to clear up a little bit and then I am going

to add in, actually what I am going to do
first is take a spoon and I am going to mix

together the salt with the flour. Add in my
dry ingredients, do it on low speed, otherwise

you are going to get covered in flour. I am
going to just let that mix in for about 30

seconds or until all the dry ingredients are
incorporated, and then I will show you the
next step.

I just dumped my dough on a floured surface
and now I am just going to take my rolling

pin and you just constantly want to keep this
dough moving because it is a really soft dough

but you want a nice buttery cookie so, keep
it moving so it does not stick. Roll this

out to about, between 1/8 and 1/4 inch thick.
I am just going to take a round cookie cutter

and I am just going to cut out my cookies.
It is such a really, it is a really, really,

really forgiving dough and you can obviously
cut the shape however your heart desires.

I am just doing simple little circles. There
they are. Now I am just going to put my cookies

into the oven and you want to make sure that
the oven rack is positioned in the center

of the oven just so that it does not burn.
If it is too low in the oven it will burn,

if it is too high up it will burn as well.
So, I am going to put these in for about 13

- 15 minutes or until they are golden brown
and I am going to probably flip or rotate

the sheet pan half way through just to get
them nice and evenly colored because I want

that even golden brown color. The cookies
baked for about 13 minutes and I have let

them cool completely and now it is time to
make the little glaze to put on top, or the

glaze or the frosting, whatever your want
to call it, well it is not really frosting. It

is a little too runny to be a frosting but
it is not so runny that it is like a thin

glaze. It is like something in between. The
ingredients for that are just some confectioner

sugar, and some cocoa powder, and some milk.
Now I am just going to do this in a bowl with

a spatula. I think a spatula just works better
but you can use a whisk if you want to. I am

just mixing the cocoa powder and the sugar
together and now I am going to add in some

milk. Now I am going to start with two tablespoons
and then I will see what the consistency is

like. If it is too thick I will add a little
bit more but do not start with too much off

the bat because it can get very runny very,
very quickly. So, I am just going to mix in

my two tablespoons and see how I am looking.
That looks perfect. I ended up using about

three tablespoons of milk, now this will harden
as it sits on the cookies and that is what

you want. I am just taking a little tiny teaspoon
and I am putting it on the cookie and then

just kind of spreading it with the back. Just
like that. I like to just cover the center

but leave some of the edges exposed. I just
think it looks nicer. But you know, to each

his own. I am just going to glaze all my cookies
and I will show you what they look like once

they are all done. Last one. Now the glaze
will set as they sit. I am not going to wait

for that, I am going to eat one right now
and with the remaining dough I just popped

it into the freezer. I always like to do that
when it comes to cookies because it is great

to have cookie dough on hand for whenever
you need it and what I do is pop it into the

microwave for about 15 to 30 seconds, and
just until it is thawed and like regular texture

like it normally would be and then just roll
them out and make fresh cookies. Sharing is

caring. I like to make fresh cookies anytime
I have company or bring them over to somebody's

house. I am going to taste one of these bad
boys. I love the cookie. It is really buttery

yet subtle. The cookie itself is not too sweet
but the glaze is nice and sweet. There is

a great balance. So delicious. So simple.
So easy. I am sure you already have the ingredients

on hand to do them so go to www.laurainthekitchen.com
to get the recipe. Make them. Let me know

how you like them and I will see you next
time. Bye bye.
